md:
giải nghĩa từ "sheath" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan và các từ trái nghĩa.

* Sheath (noun) - vỏ bao, vỏ bọc

+ Meaning: A sheath is a covering or case that protects or holds something, such as a knife or a sword.

+ Example sentence: The knife was in its sheath, ready to be used.

+ Related words: scabbard, holster, case, cover

+ Antonyms: bare, exposed, uncovered

* Sheath (verb) - bao quanh, bọc lại

+ Meaning: To sheath something means to cover or enclose it in a protective case or covering.

+ Example sentence: She sheathed the sword and put it away.

+ Related words: cover, enclose, wrap, envelop

+ Antonyms: uncover, expose, reveal
html:
giải nghĩa từ "sheath" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan và các từ trái nghĩa.

  • Sheath (noun) - vỏ bao, vỏ bọc

  • Meaning: A sheath is a covering or case that protects or holds something, such as a knife or a sword.

  • Example sentence: The knife was in its sheath, ready to be used.

  • Related words: scabbard, holster, case, cover

  • Antonyms: bare, exposed, uncovered

  • Sheath (verb) - bao quanh, bọc lại

  • Meaning: To sheath something means to cover or enclose it in a protective case or covering.

  • Example sentence: She sheathed the sword and put it away.

  • Related words: cover, enclose, wrap, envelop

  • Antonyms: uncover, expose, reveal
